alert.note: Alert for Noble (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 28 at 9:10PM EST until March 06 at 7:00PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... North Branch Elkhart River at Cosperville affecting Noble County. .No additional rainfall is expected over the next 48 hours, and snow melt where it still remains will be gradual enough to not cause additional rises on rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Branch Elkhart River at Cosperville. * WHEN...Until Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, The north end of Lakeview Drive is covered by water. Several houses have water to their foundations on Steinberger Lake Drive. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 6.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM EST Monday was 6.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
